intro: Crataegus pennsylvanica, commonly known as the Pennsylvania hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern North America. It typically grows to a height of 6–15 feet and features thorned branches, oval-shaped leaves, and clusters of white flowers in spring. The plant produces red or orange berries that are an important food source for birds and small mammals. Botanically, it belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and persistent fruiting structures.
